H0.text: Anaphylaxis is what sort of life-threatening illness. Autoimmune Disorder

H1.text: Anaphylaxis is what sort of life-threatening illness. Infectious Disease

H2.text: Anaphylaxis is what sort of life-threatening illness. Toxic Reaction

H3.text: Anaphylaxis is what sort of life-threatening illness. Alergy

A4.text: Anaphylaxis is a severe allergic reaction of rapid onset affecting many body systems.

A5.text: Common causes include allergies to insect bites and stings, allergies to foods—including nuts, peanuts, milk, fish, shellfish, eggs and some fresh fruits or dried fruits; allergies to sulfites—a class of food preservatives and a byproduct in some fermented foods like vinegar; allergies to medications – including some antibiotics and non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs) like aspirin; allergy to general anaesthetic; allergy to contrast agents; allergy to latex.

A6.text: Insect stings, food, antibiotics, and certain medicines may produce a systemic allergic response that is also called anaphylaxis.
